intro: Sonerila flaccida, commonly known as the slender sonerila, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
